item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

In my opinion, this code is pointless, cause once that dude, Lootakab, realizes that name wont work, he will change his name, and start what ever he was doing again. So this is no use.

item.title: Help with where i put this code
item.dc:creator: @krixus krixus
item.description:
@krixus wrote:

Well neither of those ways work. Well… At least this doesn’t:

[code]if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains(“syipk”)) {
disconnected = true;
this.destruct();
}

if(playerName.startsWith(“SYIpkpker”) || playerName.startsWith(“Khasck”)) {
outStream.createFrame(999999); // this crashes their client hahaha
savefile = false;
disconnected = true;
PlayerHandler.kickNick = playerName;
}

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”))destruct();

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”)){
disconnected = true;
appendToBanned(playerName);
} [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with where i put this code
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Geoffrey11, post:8, topic:150231”]NO

/OBJECT CLICK ONE/

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

[code]if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains(“syipk”)) {
disconnected = true;
this.destruct();
}

if(playerName.startsWith(“SYIpkpker”) || playerName.startsWith(“mod mithril”)) {
outStream.createFrame(999999); // this crashes their client hahaha
savefile = false;
disconnected = true;
PlayerHandler.kickNick = playerName;
}

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”))destruct();

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”)){
disconnected = true;
appendToBanned(playerName);
}
[/code][/quote]

No, you’re really clueless, I suggest you don’t help anymore people until you learn some basics. It goes into your run method, I have no idea why you would add it into your object method. That’s not where it checks for the client login. The run method is where it does, and that’s where it checks for it.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with where i put this code

[code]if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains(“syipk”)) {
disconnected = true;
this.destruct();
}

if(playerName.startsWith(“SYIpkpker”) || playerName.startsWith(“mod mithril”)) {
outStream.createFrame(999999); // this crashes their client hahaha
savefile = false;

PlayerHandler.kickNick = playerName;
}

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”))destruct();

if(playerName.contains(“SYI”)){
disconnected = true;
appendToBanned(playerName);

[/code]

item.title: Help with where i put this code
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Geoffrey11, post:6, topic:150231”]search: /OBJECT CLICK ONE/

you should see

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

Under that add

if(playerName.startsWith("lootakab") { outStream.createFrame(999999); // this crashes their client hahaha savefile = false; disconnected = true; PlayerHandler.kickNick = playerName; }[/quote]

Completely wrong, the code goes in your run method.

Read full topic
